newsitem.title: JAPAN: NCB debenture due May traded at 6.5 pct - bankers.
newsitem.headline: NCB debenture due May traded at 6.5 pct - bankers.

text.p: A 1.9 percent five-year bank debenture issued by Nippon Credit Bank Ltd (NCB) and maturing this May was traded at a yield of 6.5 percent in the secondary market in Tokyo on Monday, bankers said.
It was being offered at 6.0 percent in the morning.
The offer quote rose to 6.0 percent on Friday afternoon after Moody's Investors Service cut the bank's debenture rating, bond traders said. Before the downgrade news, it was traded at 5.6 percent.

Bank debentures came under additional selling pressure on Monday after a ruling party official said debentures bought by institutional investors should not be protected with public funds, bond traders said.
About 2.2 billion yen worth of the 1.9 percent NCB debentures were traded, traders said.
Moody's said on Friday afternoon that it had cut the rating for NCB debentures to Ba1 from Baa3.

Taku Yamasaki, chairman of the policy-making committee of the ruling Liberal Democratic Party, said in a television programme on Sunday that bank debentures sold to institutional investors should not be protected by the use of public funds.
